collections.title: Top 50 Spanish Words

words.definition: Joins two things together, like "apple and orange"
examples: Mamá y papá están en casa.

words.definition: Shows something is inside or within another thing, like being in a box
examples: El libro está en la mochila.

words.definition: Means "no" or the opposite, like not happy means sad
Shows possession or origin, like "book of John" or "from Spain"
What you use to talk about yourself, like "I am happy"
To be (permanent characteristics), like to be a friend or to be tall
The (masculine), used before masculine nouns
examples: El libro está en la mesa.

words.definition: Means together with someone, like playing with a friend
That, which, or who - connects ideas or describes things
examples: El libro que leo es interesante.

words.definition: The (feminine), used before feminine nouns
A or an (masculine), used before masculine nouns
A or an (feminine), used before feminine nouns
Is (third person singular of ser), like "he is tall"
Reflexive pronoun, like "he washes himself"
For, by, or through - shows reason, means, or movement
For or to - shows purpose or destination
Of the (masculine), contraction of de + el
examples: El color del coche es rojo.

words.definition: The (masculine plural), used before masculine plural nouns
examples: Los libros están en la estantería.

words.definition: The (feminine plural), used before feminine plural nouns
To him/her/it (indirect object), like "I give him the book"
It (masculine direct object), like "I see it"
His, her, its, or your (formal) - shows possession
Me (direct or indirect object), like "he sees me" or "he gives me"
You (direct or indirect object), like "I see you" or "I give you"
My - shows possession, like "my book"
Your (informal) - shows possession, like "your book"
If - shows a condition, like "if it rains"
examples: Si llueve, me quedo en casa.

words.definition: But - shows contrast, like "I like it but it's expensive"
Very - makes adjectives stronger, like "very big"
More - shows comparison, like "more beautiful"
Like or as - shows similarity, like "like a bird"
All or every - means everything or everyone
This (feminine) - points to something close, like "this book"
This (masculine) - points to something close, like "this car"
Well or good - shows how something is done
Only or just - means nothing more, like "only one"
Also or too - adds something more, like "me too"
Now - means at this moment, like "I'm here now"
Here - shows location close to speaker, like "I'm here"
There - shows location away from speaker, like "it's there"
When - asks about time, like "when do you arrive?"
examples: Cuando llueve, me quedo en casa.

words.definition: Where - asks about place, like "where is the book?"
How - asks about manner, like "how are you?"
What - asks about things, like "what is this?"
Who - asks about people, like "who is that?"
Because - gives a reason, like "because it's raining"
examples: Está triste porque perdió el juego.

words.definition: Until or up to - shows limit, like "until tomorrow"
Since or from - shows starting point, like "since Monday"
Between or among - shows position, like "between two things"
On, about, or over - shows position or topic, like "on the table"
examples: El libro está sobre la mesa.

words.definition: Under or below - shows position, like "under the table"
examples: El gato está bajo la mesa.

words.definition: I am (first person of ser), like "I am a student"
You are (second person of ser), like "you are tall"
We are (first person plural of ser), like "we are friends"
They are (third person plural of ser), like "they are students"

collections.description: The 50 most essential Spanish words for beginners

collections.title: Everyday Actions

words.definition: Using your voice to communicate
Putting food in your mouth and swallowing it
Taking liquid into your mouth and swallowing it
examples: Me gusta beber café por la mañana.

words.definition: Resting with your eyes closed at night
Doing a job or activity to earn money
Learning by reading, practicing, or memorizing
examples: Los estudiantes estudian para los exámenes.

words.definition: Looking at words and understanding their meaning
examples: Los niños aprenden a leer en la escuela.

words.definition: Making letters and words with a pen or keyboard
Moving on foot, one step after another
examples: Camino al trabajo todos los días.
Nos gusta caminar por el parque.

words.definition: Moving quickly on foot, faster than walking
examples: Corro en el gimnasio tres veces por semana.

words.definition: Controlling a car or vehicle to move from place to place
Getting something by paying money for it
Giving something to someone in exchange for money
Preparing food by heating it or mixing ingredients
examples: Cocino la cena para mi familia.

words.definition: making something free from dirt or mess
examples: La señora limpia la casa todos los días.

words.definition: cleaning something with water and soap
examples: Lavo los platos después de comer.
Me lavo las manos antes de comer.

words.definition: putting on clothes to cover your body
examples: Me visto rápido por la mañana.

words.definition: stopping sleeping and becoming conscious
examples: Me despierto a las siete de la mañana.

words.definition: moving something or yourself upward
examples: Me levanto de la cama temprano.

words.definition: placing your body on a chair or surface
examples: Los estudiantes se sientan en el aula.

words.definition: ending movement or activity
examples: Paro el coche en el semáforo.

words.definition: beginning an action or activity
examples: Empiezo a trabajar a las nueve.
La película empieza a las ocho.

words.definition: completing something or reaching the end
examples: Termino el trabajo a las cinco.
La clase termina a las tres.

words.definition: giving assistance or support to someone
examples: Ayudo a mi madre en la cocina.

words.definition: requiring something because it's necessary
desiring something or having affection
finding something pleasant or enjoyable
using your eyes to notice or observe something
examples: Veo una película en el cine.
No puedo ver bien sin gafas.

words.definition: using your ears to receive sound
making contact with something or playing an instrument
using your nose to detect odors
having information or knowledge about something
examples: Sé la respuesta a la pregunta.

words.definition: being familiar with someone or something
comprehending the meaning of something
gaining knowledge or skill through study or experience
helping someone learn by giving knowledge or skills
examples: Mi padre me enseña a conducir.

words.definition: engaging in games or activities for fun
examples: Los niños juegan en el parque.

words.definition: making musical sounds with your voice
examples: Canto en el coro de la iglesia.
Me gusta cantar en la ducha.

words.definition: moving your body rhythmically to music
going from one place to another, usually far away
examples: Me gusta viajar por el mundo.

words.definition: going to see someone or someplace
examples: Visito a mis abuelos los domingos.

words.definition: using a phone to contact someone or getting someone's attention
examples: Llamo a mi madre por teléfono.

words.definition: staying in a place until something happens or wishing for something
examples: Espero el autobús en la parada.

words.definition: trying to find something
examples: Busco mis llaves por toda la casa.

words.definition: discovering something you were looking for
examples: Encuentro mi libro en la biblioteca.

words.definition: no longer having something you had before
examples: Pierdo mi dinero en el casino.
No quiero perder a mi mejor amigo.

words.definition: being successful in a competition or getting money from work

collections.description: Essential Spanish verbs for daily activities and communication

collections.title: People and Places

words.definition: Person - a human being, any individual
Man - an adult male human being
examples: Los hombres trabajan en la construcción.

words.definition: Woman - an adult female human being
Child or boy - a young person, especially a male child
examples: El niño juega en el parque.
Los niños van a la escuela.

words.definition: Girl - a young female person
Family - a group of people related by blood or marriage
examples: La familia come juntos los domingos.

words.definition: Friend - a person you like and know well
examples: Mi mejor amigo vive en Barcelona.

words.definition: House or home - a building where people live
examples: Vamos a casa después del trabajo.

words.definition: City - a large town with many buildings and people
examples: Madrid es una ciudad muy bonita.

words.definition: Country - a nation with its own government and territory
Street - a public road in a city or town
examples: Mi casa está en la calle Mayor.

words.definition: Work or job - activity done to earn money
School - a place where children go to learn
examples: Los niños van a la escuela todos los días.
Mi escuela está cerca de casa.

words.definition: Hospital - a place where sick people go for medical treatment
examples: El médico trabaja en el hospital.
Mi abuela está en el hospital.

words.definition: Store or shop - a place where you can buy things
examples: La tienda cierra a las ocho.

words.definition: Restaurant - a place where you can eat food that others prepare
examples: El restaurante tiene muy buena comida.

words.definition: Park - a public area with grass, trees, and paths for recreation
examples: Los niños juegan en el parque.
Hago ejercicio en el parque todos los días.

words.definition: Beach - an area of sand next to the ocean or sea
examples: Vamos a la playa en verano.
La playa está muy bonita hoy.

words.definition: Mountain - a very high hill with steep sides
examples: Las montañas están cubiertas de nieve.

words.definition: River - a large natural stream of water flowing to the sea
examples: El río pasa por el centro de la ciudad.
Nadamos en el río durante el verano.

words.definition: Forest - a large area covered with trees

collections.description: Essential Spanish nouns for people, family, and common locations

collections.title: Feelings and Descriptions

words.definition: Happy - feeling joy or pleasure
examples: Los niños están felices en el parque.

words.definition: Sad - feeling sorrow or unhappiness
examples: La película tiene un final triste.

words.definition: Angry - feeling strong displeasure or irritation
examples: No me gusta cuando estoy enojado.

words.definition: Nervous - feeling anxious or worried
examples: Los perros se ponen nerviosos con los truenos.

words.definition: Tired - needing rest or sleep
examples: Estoy muy cansado después del trabajo.
Los niños están cansados al final del día.

words.definition: Excited - feeling enthusiastic and eager
examples: Los niños están emocionados con los regalos.

words.definition: Surprised - feeling unexpected amazement
examples: Mi madre se quedó sorprendida al verme.

words.definition: Worried - feeling anxious about something
examples: Los padres están preocupados por sus hijos.

words.definition: Big or large - of considerable size
examples: El elefante es un animal grande.

words.definition: Small or little - of limited size
Tall or high - having great height
Short or low - having little height
examples: Soy más bajo que mi padre.

words.definition: Pretty or beautiful - pleasing to look at
Ugly - unpleasant to look at
examples: No me gusta ese color feo.

words.definition: Good - of high quality or morally right
Bad - of poor quality or morally wrong
examples: El tiempo está muy malo hoy.
No es bueno ser malo con los demás.

words.definition: Easy - not difficult to do or understand
Difficult or hard - not easy to do or understand
Fast or quick - moving or happening at high speed
examples: Corro muy rápido en la carrera.

words.definition: Slow - moving or happening at low speed
examples: El internet está muy lento hoy.

words.definition: New - recently made or discovered
Old - having existed for a long time
Young - having lived for a short time
examples: Los jóvenes estudian en la universidad.

words.definition: Hot - having a high temperature
Cold - having a low temperature
Rich or delicious - having a lot of money or tasting very good
Poor - having little money or resources
examples: Ayudo a los pobres cuando puedo.

words.definition: Clean - free from dirt or impurities
examples: El agua está limpia y clara.

words.definition: Dirty - covered with dirt or impurities

collections.description: Essential Spanish adjectives for describing feelings, emotions, and characteristics

collections.title: Time and Events

words.definition: Time - the indefinite continued progress of existence
Hour - a period of time equal to 60 minutes
examples: Son las tres de la tarde.

words.definition: Minute - a period of time equal to 60 seconds
Second - a very short period of time
Day - a 24-hour period
Night - the period of darkness between sunset and sunrise
Morning - the early part of the day
examples: Me levanto temprano en la mañana.

words.definition: Afternoon - the period between noon and evening
examples: Voy al parque en la tarde.

words.definition: Week - a period of seven days
examples: La próxima semana voy de vacaciones.

words.definition: Month - a period of about four weeks
Year - a period of 12 months
examples: El año pasado viajé a España.

words.definition: Yesterday - the day before today
Today - this present day
Tomorrow - the day after today
Now - at the present time
After or later - following in time
examples: Después de comer, voy a dormir.

words.definition: Before or earlier - preceding in time
examples: Antes de salir, cierro la puerta.

words.definition: Always - at all times
Never - at no time
Sometimes - occasionally
Party or celebration - a social gathering
examples: Voy a una fiesta esta noche.
La fiesta de cumpleaños fue divertida.

words.definition: Birthday - the anniversary of the day someone was born
Vacation or holidays - a period of time away from work
examples: Me voy de vacaciones en julio.

words.definition: Work or job - activity done to earn money
Rest or break - a period of relaxation
examples: El descanso del almuerzo es a las 12.

collections.description: Essential Spanish vocabulary for time, dates, and daily events

collections.title: Spanish Conversational Phrases

words.definition: Hello - a greeting used when meeting someone
Goodbye - used when leaving or ending a conversation
Please - used to make a polite request
Thank you - used to express gratitude
You're welcome - a response to thank you
examples: De nada, fue un placer ayudarte.

words.definition: I'm sorry - used to apologize
examples: Lo siento mucho por tu pérdida.

words.definition: Excuse me or sorry - used to get attention or apologize
Excuse me - a polite way to get someone's attention
Excuse me - used when passing through or interrupting
Good morning - a greeting used in the morning
Good afternoon - a greeting used in the afternoon
Good evening or good night - used in the evening or when going to bed
How are you? (formal) - a polite way to ask about someone's well-being
How are you? (informal) - a casual way to ask about someone's well-being
Very well - a positive response to how are you
So-so or more or less - a neutral response to how are you
examples: El trabajo va más o menos bien.

words.definition: How's it going? - a casual way to ask how things are
What's your name? (formal) - used to ask someone's name politely
What's your name? (informal) - used to ask someone's name casually
My name is - used to introduce yourself
Nice to meet you - used when meeting someone for the first time
Likewise or same here - a response to nice to meet you
Do you speak English? (formal) - used to ask if someone speaks English
I don't understand - used when you don't understand something
Speak more slowly - used to ask someone to slow down their speech

collections.description: Essential Spanish phrases for everyday conversations and social interactions

collections.title: Spanish Idioms

words.id: costar un ojo de la cara-001
words.text: costar un ojo de la cara
words.definition: Something is very expensive
examples: Este coche cuesta un ojo de la cara.
Las vacaciones costaron un ojo de la cara.

words.definition: To be daydreaming or not paying attention
examples: No escuché nada, estaba en las nubes.
Siempre está en las nubes en clase.

words.definition: Something is very easy
examples: Para él, las matemáticas son pan comido.

words.definition: It's raining very heavily
examples: No salgas, está lloviendo a cántaros.

words.definition: To be crazy or acting strangely
examples: Mi hermano está como una cabra.
No le hagas caso, está como una cabra.

words.id: tirar la casa por la ventana-001
words.text: tirar la casa por la ventana
words.definition: To spend a lot of money on something
examples: En la boda tiraron la casa por la ventana.
Para su cumpleaños tiró la casa por la ventana.

words.definition: To be extremely happy
examples: Está en el séptimo cielo con su nuevo trabajo.
Cuando ganó el premio, estaba en el séptimo cielo.

words.id: no tener pelos en la lengua-001
words.text: no tener pelos en la lengua
words.definition: To speak directly and honestly
examples: Mi abuela no tiene pelos en la lengua.
Le dije la verdad, no tengo pelos en la lengua.

words.definition: to be very annoyed or tired of something
examples: Estoy hasta las narices de este trabajo.
Está hasta las narices de que le digan qué hacer.

words.definition: to be very old
examples: Mi abuelo es más viejo que Matusalén.
Ese coche es más viejo que Matusalén.

words.definition: To be very far away
examples: Su casa está en el quinto pino.
El restaurante está en el quinto pino.

words.definition: To be very close friends
examples: Ellos son uña y carne desde niños.
Mi hermana y yo somos uña y carne.

words.id: estar como pez en el agua-001
words.text: estar como pez en el agua
words.definition: To feel very comfortable in a situation
examples: En la playa está como pez en el agua.
En su trabajo está como pez en el agua.

words.id: no hay moros en la costa-001
words.text: no hay moros en la costa
words.definition: There's no danger or obstacles
examples: No hay moros en la costa, podemos salir.
Espera hasta que no haya moros en la costa.

words.id: estar en la luna de Valencia-001
words.text: estar en la luna de Valencia
words.definition: To be unrealistic or not paying attention
examples: Siempre está en la luna de Valencia.
No le hables, está en la luna de Valencia.

words.id: ser más listo que el hambre-001
words.text: ser más listo que el hambre
words.definition: To be very clever or smart
examples: Mi hijo es más listo que el hambre.
Esa chica es más lista que el hambre.

words.definition: To be red with anger
examples: Cuando se enteró, estaba hecho un ají.
No le hables, está hecho un ají.

words.id: ser del año de la pera-001
words.text: ser del año de la pera
words.definition: To be very old or outdated
examples: Ese coche es del año de la pera.
Su teléfono es del año de la pera.

words.definition: To be very excited or hyperactive
examples: Los niños están como una moto.
Está como una moto con las vacaciones.

words.definition: To be unsuccessful at everything
examples: Hoy no doy pie con bola.
En el trabajo no doy pie con bola.

collections.description: Common Spanish idioms and expressions for natural fluency

collections.title: Business and Work

words.definition: An organization that provides goods or services
examples: La empresa tiene más de 500 empleados.

words.definition: A person who works for a company
examples: Soy empleado de una empresa de tecnología.
Los empleados están muy contentos con el nuevo jefe.

words.definition: A person in charge of others at work
examples: Mi jefe es muy exigente pero justo.
El jefe de departamento está en una reunión.

words.definition: A gathering of people to discuss business matters
examples: La reunión duró más de dos horas.

words.definition: A planned piece of work with specific goals
examples: Estoy trabajando en un proyecto muy interesante.
El proyecto debe estar terminado en un mes.

words.definition: A plan for spending money
examples: El presupuesto para este año es muy ajustado.
Necesitamos aprobar el presupuesto del proyecto.

words.definition: A legal agreement between parties
examples: Firmé un contrato de trabajo por dos años.
El contrato expira el próximo mes.

words.definition: Salary - the money paid regularly for work
Schedule or timetable - a plan of when things happen
examples: Mi horario de trabajo es de 9 a 6.

words.definition: Vacation or holidays - time off from work
examples: Me voy de vacaciones en agosto.
Tengo dos semanas de vacaciones por año.

words.definition: To end someone's employment
examples: No quieren despedir a nadie más.

words.definition: To give someone a job
examples: La empresa va a contratar nuevos empleados.

words.definition: To discuss to reach an agreement
To put money into something to make a profit
examples: La empresa invierte mucho en tecnología.

words.definition: To try to win against others
examples: Nuestra empresa compite con las mejores.
Es difícil competir en este mercado.

words.definition: To grow or improve something
To arrange things in order
To watch and direct work
examples: Mi trabajo es supervisar el proyecto.

words.definition: A formal meeting to assess a candidate
examples: Tengo una entrevista de trabajo mañana.

words.definition: Resume or CV - a document with work experience and qualifications
examples: Envié mi currículum a varias empresas.

words.definition: Experience - knowledge gained from doing something
Skill - the ability to do something well
Objective or goal - something you want to achieve
examples: Los objetivos del proyecto son claros.

words.definition: Strategy - a plan to achieve a goal
examples: Necesitamos una nueva estrategia de marketing.

words.definition: Productivity - the rate at which work is done
examples: La productividad ha aumentado este año.

collections.description: Essential Spanish vocabulary for business, work, and professional environments

collections.title: Travel and Tourism

words.definition: Trip or journey - an act of traveling from one place to another
examples: Mi viaje a España fue increíble.

words.definition: To go from one place to another
examples: Me gusta viajar por el mundo.

words.definition: A person who travels for pleasure
The place where someone is going
A place where planes take off and land
A vehicle that flies through the air
examples: El avión despegó a las 3 PM.

words.definition: A vehicle that runs on tracks
A large vehicle that carries many passengers
A car that you pay to take you somewhere
examples: Llamé un taxi para ir al hotel.
El taxi es muy caro aquí.

words.definition: A place where travelers can stay overnight
examples: Reservé una habitación en el hotel.

words.definition: A room in a hotel where you sleep
To arrange to use something later
Bags and suitcases for traveling
A document needed to travel to other countries
Official permission to enter a country
examples: Necesito una visa para viajar a Estados Unidos.
La visa expira en seis meses.

words.definition: A piece of paper that allows you to travel
A large bag for carrying clothes when traveling
A bag carried on the back
A drawing that shows where places are
examples: Necesito un mapa de la ciudad.
El mapa está en el teléfono.

words.definition: A person who shows tourists around
examples: El guía nos explicó la historia.

words.definition: A short journey for pleasure or learning about something while traveling
examples: Hicimos una excursión a la montaña.
La excursión duró todo el día.

words.definition: A structure built to remember someone or something
A building where you can see art and historical objects
examples: El museo está cerrado los lunes.

words.definition: An area of sand next to the ocean
examples: Vamos a la playa todos los días.

words.definition: A very high hill
examples: Las montañas están cubiertas de nieve.

words.definition: The customs and traditions of a country
examples: Me interesa mucho la cultura local.
La cultura española es muy rica.

words.definition: A custom that has been passed down through generations
The art of cooking and eating good food
Souvenir - something you buy to remember a place
examples: Compré muchos souvenirs para mi familia.

collections.description: Essential Spanish vocabulary for travel, tourism, and cultural experiences
